instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Hello
working on a board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> machine.

the mac is dead, does not charge or power on..

while checking with usb c measuring tool on the charger
it is drawing 5.17V and 0.01A

took out the logicboard, looks very clean, missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
and also missing every other power rail, actually can't seem to find any working power rail...

any advice on how to move forward?
any common issue, missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with theses boards is worth checking?

on diode mode i get direct short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

i have two in exact same condition \ issue..

please you adsive..

thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Post the exact ohm resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>; switch to ohm scale.
Compare with the value on the big coils; pay atention to CPU and GPU coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0.3 ohm to ground.
big coils around cpu and gpu, i hope i understood correctly - measured for exa. on 
L7211 - 2.7ohm
L7221 - 2.7ohm
L7231 - 3.0ohm
LA340 - 1.6ohm
LA640 - 1.4ohm
LA650 - 1.4ohm

measured all with black probe to ground

between <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and L7211 there is 2.6ohm

my mistake earier - it wasnt diode mode, just ohm mode with a beep
getting a continuation(beep) between ground and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and also between ground and L7211

not sure if that how it should be, don't have a good board to compare with :(

thanks for the help...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Lift mentioned coils one side (one by one) and check if short disappears from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
